author: @CNBCTV18Live
title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw counters Siddarmaiah claims linking Covid vaccines to heart-related deaths in Hassan
text:
3 Min Read
Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw countered Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and stated that COVID-19 vaccines developed in India were approved under the Emergency Use Authorisation framework.
The remarks came after Siddaramaiah linked heart-related deaths in Hassan district of Karnataka to Covid vaccine. He had said "hasty approval and distribution" of the Covid vaccine to the public could also be a reason for these deaths.
"COVID-19 vaccines developed in India were approved under the Emergency Use Authorisation framework, following rigorous protocols aligned with global standards for safety and efficacy. To suggest that these vaccines were â€˜hastilyâ€™ approved is factually incorrect and contributes to public misinformation. These vaccines have saved millions of lives and, like all vaccines, may cause side effects in a very small number of individuals. It is important to acknowledge the science and data-driven processes behind their development, rather than engage in retrospective blame," Shaw said in a post on X.
Union Health Ministry statement
On July 2, the Union Health Ministry said extensive studies by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and AIIMS have conclusively established
Sudden cardiac deaths can result from a wide range of factors, including genetics, lifestyle, pre-existing conditions, and post-Covid complications, the ministry said in a statement.
Siddaramaiah remarks
The Karnataka chief minister had said more than 20 people have died due to heart attacks in the past month alone in just one district of Hassan.
"The government is taking this matter very seriously. To identify the exact cause of these series of deaths and to find solutions, a committee of experts has been formed under the leadership of Dr Ravindranath, Director of Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Sciences and Research, and they have been instructed to submit a study report within 10 days," he said in a post on X.
The remarks came after Siddaramaiah linked heart-related deaths in Hassan district of Karnataka to Covid vaccine. He had said "hasty approval and distribution" of the Covid vaccine to the public could also be a reason for these deaths.
Shaw said Covid vaccines saved million of lives and it may have caused side effects in a very small number of people. "To suggest that these vaccines were â€˜hastilyâ€™ approved is factually incorrect and contributes to public misinformation," she said.
"COVID-19 vaccines developed in India were approved under the Emergency Use Authorisation framework, following rigorous protocols aligned with global standards for safety and efficacy. To suggest that these vaccines were â€˜hastilyâ€™ approved is factually incorrect and contributes to public misinformation. These vaccines have saved millions of lives and, like all vaccines, may cause side effects in a very small number of individuals. It is important to acknowledge the science and data-driven processes behind their development, rather than engage in retrospective blame," Shaw said in a post on X.
COVID-19 vaccines developed in India were approved under the Emergency Use Authorisation framework, following rigorous protocols aligned with global standards for safety and efficacy. To suggest that these vaccines were â€˜hastilyâ€™ approved is factually incorrect and contributes toâ€¦â€” Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw (@kiranshaw)
[https://t.co/uMEcMXzBV0] [July 3, 2025]
Union Health Ministry statement
On July 2, the Union Health Ministry said extensive studies by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and AIIMS have conclusively established
no linkages between coronavirus vaccines and sudden deaths. The ministry said these studies by the ICMR and National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) affirm that COVID-19 vaccines in India are safe and effective, with extremely rare instances of serious side effects, it said.
Sudden cardiac deaths can result from a wide range of factors, including genetics, lifestyle, pre-existing conditions, and post-Covid complications, the ministry said in a statement.
Siddaramaiah remarks
The Karnataka chief minister had said more than 20 people have died due to heart attacks in the past month alone in just one district of Hassan.
"The government is taking this matter very seriously. To identify the exact cause of these series of deaths and to find solutions, a committee of experts has been formed under the leadership of Dr Ravindranath, Director of Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Sciences and Research, and they have been instructed to submit a study report within 10 days," he said in a post on X.

author: Conchi GarcÃ­a
title: Esta es probabilidad de lluvias en MÃ¡laga para la Cabalgata de Reyes Magos
text:
Aumenta la probabilidad de lluvias en MÃ¡laga para la Cabalgata de Reyes Magos
La Aemet fija un 100% de posibilidades de precipitaciÃ³n a partir de las 18:00 horas del domingo en toda la provincia
MÃ¡laga descarta adelantar su Cabalgata de Reyes Magos al sÃ¡bado, pero baraja el domingo por la maÃ±ana
La lluvia amenaza con aguar la Cabalgata de Reyes Magos de MÃ¡laga, la Ãºltima gran cita de las fiestas navideÃ±as, y la mÃ¡s ilusionante para los niÃ±os. La probabilidad de precipitaciones para el domingo por la tarde, fecha y hora en la que tradicionalmente realizan su salida Sus Majestades de Oriente, aumenta conforme pasan las horas y son ya del 100% en toda la provincia a partir de las 18:00 horas.
La previsiÃ³n del tiempo es clara, segÃºn explica el director del Centro MeteorolÃ³gico de MÃ¡laga, JesÃºs Riesco. El paso de un frente dejarÃ¡ lluvias en toda la provincia de MÃ¡laga el domingo por la tarde, aunque en principio los modelos dibujan el cielo despejado para toda la jornada del sÃ¡bado y la maÃ±ana del domingo. AsÃ­, serÃ¡ en la segunda mitad del domingo cuando empiecen las precipitaciones, que afectarÃ¡n a toda la provincia y que continuarÃ¡n tambiÃ©n en el dÃ­a de Reyes, el lunes 6 de enero.
"A dÃ­a de hoy -este viernes- la predicciÃ³n apunta claramente a que no va llover el domingo por la maÃ±ana en MÃ¡laga", afirma Riesco, que no obstante recuerda que "esto estÃ¡ sujeto a posibles actualizaciones de la predicciÃ³n".
La Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a (Aemet) muestra la evoluciÃ³n detallada de estas lluvias. En principio, la entrada del frente en la provincia de MÃ¡laga estÃ¡ prevista para las 16:00 o 17:00 horas del domingo. Como suele ser habitual en este tipo de situaciones, la lluvia comenzarÃ¡ a caer por la parte mÃ¡s occidental e irÃ¡ recorriendo el territorio malagueÃ±o hacia el este.
AsÃ­, el director de la Aemet en MÃ¡laga precisa que a partir de las 17:00 horas del domingo, lo que ahora se ve en los modelos es que aumenta la probabilidad de precipitaciones dÃ©biles, y desde las 19:00 ya son "mucho mÃ¡s probables y puntutalmente moderadas".
Estas precipitaciones se irÃ¡n manteniendo durante todo el dÃ­a desde que empiecen en cada localidad y tambiÃ©n se extenderÃ¡n al dÃ­a de Reyes, aunque por la tarde irÃ¡n tendiendo a remitir. SegÃºn apunta Riesco, serÃ¡n "dÃ©biles y localmente moderadas", incluso con tormentas en la mitad occidental de la provincial. SerÃ¡n mÃ¡s abundantes en el interior, especialmente en la SerranÃ­a de Ronda.
MÃ¡laga baraja la Cabalgata el domingo por la maÃ±ana
En principio, la salida de la Cabalgata de MÃ¡laga capital estÃ¡ prevista para las 18:00 horas del domingo, pero la concejala de Fiestas, Teresa Porras, ha explicado este viernes en rueda de prensa que "ya se estÃ¡ trabajando en distintas alternativas" ante la amenaza de lluvias. De momento, se ha descartado adelantarla al sÃ¡bado, dÃ­a en el que tienen lugar los cortejos reales en los distritos, pero se baraja que se celebre el domingo por la maÃ±ana. En cualquier caso, la edil ha dejado claro que la decisiÃ³n definitiva no se tomarÃ¡ hasta el mismo sÃ¡bado.
Otros municipios sÃ­ han anunciado ya los cambios en sus cabalgata de Reyes Magos. Hay varios en los que Melchor, Gaspar y Baltasar han adelantado su salida al sÃ¡bado (Marbella, Estepona, Mijas, Torremolinos, Nerja y Antequera) y otros en los que el cortejo real se celebrarÃ¡ el domingo por la maÃ±ana, como AlhaurÃ­n de la Torre (11:00 horas) y Ronda (12:00).

title: Un vaixell de cereals embarranca al Danubi en esclatar una mina | C. S | barcelona | PolÃ­tica | El Punt Avui
text: Guerra a UcraÃ¯na Un vaixell de cereals embarranca al Danubi en esclatar una mina La guerra entre UcraÃ¯na i RÃºssia viu uns dies centrada en episodis i atacs prop del Mar Negre, Crimea i la desembocadura del Danubi. Avui ha embarrancat un vaixell que es dirigia a carregar cereals dels que exporta UcraÃ¯na. Una mina marina ha esclatat i ha deixat el vaixell a la deriva davant del port dâ€™Izmail, al tram final del Danubi. El capitÃ  del carguer ha pogut redirigir-lo fins que ha embarrancat, segons explicaven fonts de la marina turca, dâ€™on provenia la majoria dels tripulants. Quatre membres de la tripulaciÃ³, de nacionalitat turca, van resultar ferits lleument. El vaixell Vyssos havia salpat de GrÃ¨cia. Diversos mitjans dâ€™aquest paÃ­s asseguren que el capitÃ  va evitar lâ€™enfonsament del vaixell duent-lo cap a una zona amb menys profunditat per tal que encallÃ©s, i deixar aixÃ­ lliure elpas cap al port dâ€™Izmail. Aquest enclau mantÃ© actiu el port ucraÃ¯nÃ©s mÃ©s important al llarg del Danubi. Ã‰s a nomÃ©s 80 quilÃ²metres del Mar Negre. Funciona sense interrupciÃ³ des de la invasiÃ³ russa, tot i que sovint, el port rep atacs amb drons. El ministeri de la Marina ucrainÃ©s assegurava ahir que la mina amb que havia topat el vaixell havia estat llanÃ§ada des de lâ€™aire en alguna incursiÃ³ aÃ¨ria. Tot i aixÃ², sobta que no fos detectada pels equips que rastregen el Danubi per facilitar-ne el trÃ nsit naval. author: @NewsLatinPress
title: Cuba will apply salary increases to health workers - Prensa Latina
text: From that date, the additional monthly payment for years of services provided will be effective, the payment for night shifts of doctors, stomatologists, nursing staff and health technologists will be increased, and for hours worked on weekends by doctors and stomatologists. Remuneration for special working conditions will also be included for doctors and stomatologists who are located in rural and difficult-to-access units, and for nurses who work in services that require a higher level of responsibility or where the characteristics of the pathology to be treated requires an effort greater than normal. The provision also establishes for doctors, stomatologists, nursing staff, psychologists, technologists and other graduates and technicians who perform specific functions in healthcare activity, who work in the budgeted sector, the additional monthly payment for years of services provided. Time worked is considered to be accumulated in the exercise of the profession, whether continuous or not. In addition, the Resolution published by the Official Gazette authorizes payment to health professionals for the maximum effort by greater care, teaching, research and other services that ensure the vitality of the system. For the entry into force of these measures as of January 1, 2024, the Ministry of Public Health approved the general procedure, the requirements, conditions and indicators for the implementation of payment for maximum effort, as well as the mechanisms for its control. ef/rgh/crc

author: Business Standard
title: TCS to roll out salary hikes for 80% of staff starting September 1 | Company News - Business Standard
text:
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will provide salary hikes for a majority of its employees from September 1, the company said in an internal memo on Wednesday. â€œWe are pleased to announce a compensation revision for all eligible associates in grades up to C3A and equivalent, covering 80 per cent of our workforce,â€ a message from Chief Human Resources Officer Milind Lakkad and CHRO-designate K Sudeep stated. TCS was the first company to stall hikes in April, citing an unfavourable and uncertain macroeconomic environment. It maintained this position even last month while announcing its second-quarter results, stating that a decision would be taken at an appropriate time. The grade structure at TCS begins with Y for trainees, followed by systems engineer at C1, and continues through C2, C3A and B, C4, C5, up to CXO level. Employees in the C3 band are generally classified as senior staff. However, in July, the company also announced plans to cut about 2 per cent of its workforceâ€”around 12,000 employeesâ€”stating they could not be deployed on projects due to rapidly evolving AI skillsets. These employees, mostly mid- to senior-level managers who have spent decades with the company, were being let go as TCS aimed to protect operating margins, which were under strain. Analysts said last week that the retrenchment would provide the company with an opportunity to raise salaries for the remaining workforce. The decision to revise salaries will be a welcome relief for TCS employees, and other companies may follow suit. Cognizant, which was scheduled to implement salary hikes from August 1, has also said it will take a decision on the timing of hikes in the second half of its fiscal, with the intention of covering most employees. Don't miss the most important news and views of the day. Get them on our

author: @KKCO11News
title: Fort Carson Fire caused by human
text:
Fort Carson Fire caused by human
The fire is fully contained but burned through 776 acres.
Published: Mar. 5, 2025 at 6:49 PM MST|Updated: seconds ago
GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. (KKCO) -According to Air Now, the Fort Carson Fire Department, the Fort Carson, Colorado fire was caused by a human. Specific details have not been revealed.
The fire, which started on Feb. 24, is fully contained but burned through 776 acres, according to FCFD. It didnâ€™t harm any roads or structures.

author: Kgomotso Moganedi
title: Oscar Mgudlwa, popularly known as Madluphuthu, has died
text:
Oscar Mgudlwa, popularly known as Madluphuthu, has died
Bongani â€œMadluphuthuâ€ Mgudlwa, the actor and comedian who brought laughter to countless homes, has died.
Best known for his iconic role in the cult favourite Madluphuthu film series of the early 2000s. Mgudlwa became a household name for his hilarious, unfiltered takes on township life.
His raw, relatable, humorous storytelling not only made audiences laugh but also captured the daily struggles and spirit of Mzansiâ€™s kasi culture.
It's understood he died on Wednesday morning and within hours, â€œRIP Madluphuthuâ€ was trending across social media platforms.
His son Asanda took to social media to share the news, saying: â€œRest in peace dad. I love you and I will forever love you, Madiba Dlomo.â€
In his later years Mgudlwa featured on e.tv's Isitha and also created music, helping young talent in the music industry as a songwriter.
From diehard fans to fellow creatives, tributes poured in to celebrate a man who brought joy during difficult times. â€œHe wasnâ€™t just an actor, he was a symbol of resilience and creativity,â€ one fan posted. â€œMadluphuthu made us laugh even when life gave us no reason to.â€
Despite working with tight budgets, Mgudlwaâ€™s films became cultural touchstones, proving that authenticity always wins hearts. His legacy lives on in the laughter he gave people and the bold way he held up a mirror to society.
â€” Entertainment (@TvblogbyMLU)
[#RIPBonganiMgudlwa]
The legendary actor & comedian, best known for his iconic role as Madluphuthu in the early 2000â€™s township series has left us far too soon. Our thoughts are with his loved ones ðŸ™ðŸ½[pic.twitter.com/dcmunFGmNw][July 16, 2025]
Totally heartbroken to announce the passing of our brother/ friend Oscar Madluphuthu Mgudlwa aka

I canâ€™t believe thisðŸ’” RIP uncleðŸ˜­
â€” MBULELO MGUDLWA (@Jay_leloSA)[pic.twitter.com/ti8xHT3VE9][July 16, 2025]

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Floyd County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Floyd County, Georgia from 1901-2000 was 42.3. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Floyd County, Georgia experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Floyd County, Georgia history.

author: Agencia ICAL
title: El Museo de la MinerÃ­a de Sabero propone talleres infantiles, visitas teatralizadas y mÃºsica para cerrar el aÃ±o
text:
El Museo de la MinerÃ­a de Sabero propone talleres infantiles, visitas teatralizadas y mÃºsica para cerrar el aÃ±o
El Museo de la Siderurgia y la MinerÃ­a de Castilla y LeÃ³n, con sede en la localidad leonesa de Sabero, cerrarÃ¡ este fin de semana la programaciÃ³n del aÃ±o con una variada programaciÃ³n que incluye exposiciones, talleres infantiles, visitas teatralizadas, flamenco y mÃºsica celta.
La programaciÃ³n comenzarÃ¡ el viernes, 27 de diciembre, a las 19 horas, cuando se subirÃ¡ al escenario JesÃºs Corbacho, el ganador de la â€˜LÃ¡mpara Mineraâ€™ del Festival Internacional del Cante de Las Minas de La UniÃ³n en la ediciÃ³n de este aÃ±o.
Un dÃ­a despuÃ©s, el sÃ¡bado 28, a las 18.30 horas, el escenario cambiarÃ¡ de estilo y darÃ¡ paso al grupo â€˜Lugh MÃºsica Celtaâ€™, que ofrecerÃ¡ un concierto dirigido a todos los pÃºblicos en el que melodÃ­as alegres, ritmos frenÃ©ticos y pegadizos, ecos de mÃºsica tradicional y armonÃ­as envolventes harÃ¡n un viaje musical por distintas culturas celtas que forman parte del patrimonio de la PenÃ­nsula IbÃ©rica.
TambiÃ©n el domingo 29, a las 11.30 y a las 13 horas, se ofrecerÃ¡n visitas teatralizadas a la FerrerÃ­a de San Blas, en las que los actores Manuel Ferrero y Pablo Parra encarnan al ingeniero Torreta y el guÃ­a FermÃ­n para explicar de una forma didÃ¡ctica y divertida la historia de la FerrerÃ­a.
Los mÃ¡s pequeÃ±os tambiÃ©n tienen su cita con el museo en estas fechas, para loque en las maÃ±anas de los dÃ­as 26, 27 y 28 disfrutarÃ¡n de la actividad â€˜Divernavidadâ€™, con talleres en los que podrÃ¡n hacer desde adornos navideÃ±os a dulces. La actividad, dirigida a niÃ±os de cuatro a doce aÃ±os, es gratuita y requiere inscripciÃ³n previa.
Exposiciones temporales
El Museo de la Siderurgia y la MinerÃ­a de Castilla y LeÃ³n ofrece durante estas fechas navideÃ±as la posibilidad de visitar de manera gratuita tres exposiciones temporales. La primera de ellas es â€˜Retratos mineros. Las mil caras de Santa BÃ¡rbaraâ€™, del fotÃ³grafo Ruben Mediavilla, que presenta 38 retratos de mineros que trabajaron durante aÃ±os en la Cuenca Minera de Sabero.
Por su parte, â€˜CompaÃ±ero animalâ€™ es un recuerdo a todos aquellos animales que compartieron con los mineros su duro trabajo y que sin embargo son los grandes olvidados de la mina. Finalmente, â€˜Los Belenes de Teresitaâ€™ reÃºne mÃ¡s de 50 belenes de diferentes estilos y partes del mundo, propiedad de la coleccionista Teresita del NiÃ±o JesÃºs.

author: Ethan Brehm
title: Huckberry Partners with Timex on a Sub-$400 Titanium Field Watch
text:
Huckberry is no stranger to remarkable watch collaborations. This past year, they partnered with the likes of Zodiac on a titanium Super Sea Wolf Skin Diver and helped Timex reissue its late-â€™90s Ironman Flix
digital watch. Well, the online retailer is back at it again with Timex, with a simple yet stunning field watch in titanium.
One of our favorite aspects of field watches in general is how remarkable they can be without drawing much attention to themselves. For this Huckberry x Timex Titanium Field Watch, the beauty is truly in the details: the bead-blasted
titanium case thatâ€™s incredibly lightweight on your wrist, the high visibility thanks to clear hour markers and C3 Swiss SuperLuminova on the hands and indices, and the interchangeable #tide ocean nylon straps in blue and olive green. Inspired by the Northern Lights, the blue-colored lume provides a beautiful contrast against the matte white dial, even when itâ€™s not in low light. And then there are the technical specs. With 200m of water resistance, this shock-resistant timepiece can go just about anywhere, and despite the 41mm case size, the timepiece should wear much smaller due to the case material and the 12.5mm height.
On the inside, the simple time and date functions are powered by a Japanese-made automatic movement with 44 hours of power reserve. The mechanism can be viewed through the exhibition caseback, which features the logos of both Huckberry and Timex, with the movementâ€™s custom rotor engraved with
Timexâ€™s wordmark. Likewise, Huckberryâ€™s logo can also be seen on the screw-down crown.
Perhaps the most notable part about all of Timexâ€™s watches is how affordable they are without losing anything in the way of performance. This Huckberry x Timex Titanium Automatic Field Watch is priced at $375 and can be purchased now from Huckberryâ€™s web store.
